intro: Diplostachyum tenellum, commonly known as the small-leaf torch bamboo, is a species of flowering plant in the family Bromeliaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, bamboo-like stems and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
